conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graphs for Cars A and B to compare average velocities from t=0 to t=t1
Car A starts at velocity v1 at t=0 and increases to velocity v2 at t=t1; Car B starts at velocity v2 at t=0 and decreases to velocity v1 at t=t1
Average velocity is displacement divided by time interval, or area under v-t curve divided by time interval
Average velocity of Car A is area under curve A divided by t1; Average velocity of Car B is area under curve B divided by t1
Area under curve A represents total displacement of Car A; Area under curve B represents total displacement of Car B
Sum of areas under curves A and B equals area of rectangle with height (v2-v1) and width t1
Average velocities vA_avg and vB_avg sum to v1 + v2 due to symmetry of curves
Based on visual symmetry, vA_avg = vB_avg = (v1 + v2)/2
Average velocities of Car A and Car B are equal, both are (v1+v2)/2
